麠麠麠

Related Character(s): 麖
Связанный символ (и): 麖

麠字的基本解释

麠
jīng
水鹿。亦称“马鹿”、“黑鹿”。

麠字的汉语字典释义

[①]［jīng］
［《廣韻》舉卿切，平庚，見。］
亦作“麠1”。
鹿的一种。水鹿。又名马鹿、黑鹿。古称大麃。体高壮，栗棕色，耳大而直立，四肢细长，性机警，善奔跑。尾密生蓬松的毛，黑棕色。雄者有角，为名贵药材。产于今四川北部、云南、广东、海南及台湾等地。

麠字的康熙字典解释

【亥集下】【鹿字部】　麠； 康熙笔画：24； 页码：页1511第26
【唐韻】舉卿切【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】居卿切，?音京。【說文】大鹿也。【爾雅·釋獸】麠，大麃，牛尾，一角。【註】漢武帝郊雍得一角獸，若麃然，謂之麟者，此是也。俗作麖。

麠字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体韩国明朝体
麠字的起名意思

暂无。

Glutinous rice
Basic explanation of words
Glutinous rice
jīng
Sambar. Also known as "Red Deer" and "Black Deer".
Glutinous rice
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［jīng］
["Guangyun" Ju Qingqie, Ping Geng, see. ]
Also known as "麠1".
A kind of deer. Sambar. Also known as red deer and black deer. In ancient times, it was called Dazhu. He is tall and strong, chestnut brown, ears are large and erect, limbs are slender, alert, and good at running. The tail is densely covered with fluffy hairs, dark brown. The male has horns and is a precious medicinal material. Produced in today's northern Sichuan, Yunnan, Guangdong, Hainan and Taiwan.
Glutinous rice
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Hai Ji 2] [Deer Department] 　麠; Kangxi Strokes: 24; Page Number: Page 1511 Page 26
[Tang Yun] Ju Qing cut [Ji Yun] [Yun Hui] [Zheng Yun] Ju Qing cut,? Yin Jing. [Said the text] Dalu also. 【Erya·Shi Beast】Noodle, big noodle, oxtail, one horn. [Note] Emperor Wu of the Han Dynasty had a horned beast in the suburbs. Vulgar.
Glutinous rice
